empty_value.comment: Text displayed when a data field has no value. Used throughout the application to represent null or undefined values in data displays and tables.

gs.date.at.comment: Preposition used for connecting date and time expressions, e.g., 'January 1, 2023 at 3:00 PM'. Used in various date-time displays throughout the application.

gs.time.comment: Global string for displaying time units or labels. Used in various time-related components or expressions, such as 'Meeting time' or timestamp displays.

gs.header.help.comment: Label for the help button in the global application header. Clicking this opens the help menu or documentation.

gs.header.help.label.comment: ARIA label for the help links section in the help menu. Used for accessibility purposes to describe the collection of help-related links.

gs.header.search.comment: A global semantic search button label in the main menu

gs.header.ai.comment: A global open AI Assistant button label in the main menu

gs.header.logo.title.accessibility.comment: Accessibility text for the application logo in the header. Used by screen readers to identify the logo element.

gs.header.href.accessibility.comment: Accessibility text describing the action of clicking the application logo in the header, which navigates to the homepage.

gs.header.accessibility.label.comment: ARIA label for the main header section of the application. Used by screen readers to identify the header area.

gs.header.menu.accessibility.label.comment: ARIA label for the primary navigation menu in the header. Used by screen readers to identify the main navigation area.

gs.header.notifications.comment: A global notifications button label in the main menu

gs.header.logout.comment: Label for the logout button in the user menu. Clicking this signs the user out of their current session.

gs.header.workspaceSettings.comment: Label for the workspace settings option in the user menu. Clicking this navigates to the workspace configuration page.

gs.header.account.title.comment: Title for the user account menu in the header. Displays user-related options like profile settings and logout.

gs.list.all.comment: Option in filter controls to select all items. Used in various dropdown lists and filter components.

gs.list.except.comment: Used in filter expressions to indicate exclusion, e.g., 'All except [selected items]'. Appears in filter components.

gs.list.is.comment: Used in filter expressions to indicate equality, e.g., 'Product is Shoes'. Appears in filter component descriptions.

gs.list.search.placeholder.comment: Placeholder text displayed in search input fields within list components, prompting users to enter search terms.

gs.list.acessibility.search.label.comment: ARIA label for search input fields in attribute filter components. Used by screen readers to identify the search functionality.

gs.list.searchResults.comment: Label for indicating search results in filter dropdowns and list components. Used in phrases like '5 search results'.

gs.visualizationsList.loading.comment: Loading indicator text shown while visualizations or data are being fetched or processed.

gs.color-picker.inputPlaceholder.comment: Placeholder text in the color input field, showing the expected format for hexadecimal color codes.

gs.color-picker.currentColor.comment: Label for the currently selected color in the color picker component. Appears next to the color swatch.

gs.color-picker.newColor.comment: Label for the newly selected color in the color picker component. Appears next to the new color swatch being chosen.

gs.color-picker.cancelButton.comment: Label for the cancel button in the color picker dialog. Clicking this discards color changes and closes the dialog.

gs.color-picker.okButton.comment: Label for the OK/confirm button in the color picker dialog. Clicking this applies the selected color and closes the dialog.

gs.color-picker.hex.comment: label that inidicates that user should enter hexadecimal color value, e.g. #C0D6E4

gs.noData.noMatchingData.comment: Message displayed when no data matches the current filter criteria in visualizations or data views.

gs.noData.noDataAvailable.comment: Message displayed when no data is available for the current visualization or view based on the applied filters or data configuration.

geochart.scroll.zoom.blocker.value: Use {button} + scroll to zoom the map
geochart.scroll.zoom.blocker.comment: This message will appear when map zooming on GeoChart is disabled and available only, while the button is pressed.

geochart.touch.pan.blocker.value: Use two fingers to move the map
geochart.touch.pan.blocker.comment: This message will appear when moving map on GeoChart is disabled by one finger and available only with two.

visualizations.of.comment: Pagination indicator showing current page number and total pages (e.g., '2 of 5'). The {page} and {pagesCount} placeholders will be replaced with actual numbers.

visualizations.totals.dropdown.title.sum.comment: Total of type 'Sum'. Showed in menu before adding to table.

visualizations.totals.dropdown.title.avg.comment: Total of type 'Avg'. Showed in menu before adding to table.

visualizations.totals.dropdown.title.min.comment: Total of type 'Min'. Showed in menu before adding to table.

visualizations.totals.dropdown.title.max.comment: Total of type 'Max'. Showed in menu before adding to table.

visualizations.totals.dropdown.title.nat.comment: Total of type 'Rollup' where 'Total' is hint and synonym. Showed in menu before adding to table.

visualizations.totals.dropdown.tooltip.n.value: Rollup (Total) aggregation is not available when filtering the visualization by measure value. To use Rollup (Total), remove all measure value filters from the filter bar.
visualizations.totals.dropdown.tooltip.n.comment: The tooltip that is shown in pivot's table totals menu when rollup (native) total is disabled because measure value filters are configured for the pivot.

visualizations.totals.dropdown.tooltip.n.value: Rollup (Total) aggregation is not available when filtering the visualization by metric value. To use Rollup (Total), remove all metric value filters from the filter bar.
visualizations.totals.dropdown.tooltip.n.comment: The tooltip that is shown in pivot's table totals menu when rollup (native) total is disabled because metric value filters are configured for the pivot.

visualizations.totals.dropdown.tooltip.n.value: Rollup (Total) aggregation is not available when filtering the report by measure value. To use Rollup (Total), remove all measure value filters from the filter bar.
visualizations.totals.dropdown.tooltip.n.comment: The tooltip that is shown in pivot's table totals menu when rollup (native) total is disabled because measure value filters are configured for the pivot.

visualizations.totals.dropdown.tooltip.n.value: Rollup (Total) aggregation is not available when filtering the report by metric value. To use Rollup (Total), remove all metric value filters from the filter bar.
visualizations.totals.dropdown.tooltip.n.comment: The tooltip that is shown in pivot's table totals menu when rollup (native) total is disabled because metric value filters are configured for the pivot.

visualizations.totals.dropdown.tooltip.n.value: Rollup (Total) aggregation is not available when filtering the visualization by ranking filter. To use Rollup (Total), remove ranking filter from the filter bar.
visualizations.totals.dropdown.tooltip.n.comment: The tooltip that is shown in pivot's table totals menu when rollup (native) total is disabled because ranking filters are configured for the pivot.

visualizations.totals.dropdown.tooltip.n.value: Rollup (Total) aggregation is not available when filtering the report by ranking filter. To use Rollup (Total), remove ranking filter from the filter bar.
visualizations.totals.dropdown.tooltip.n.comment: The tooltip that is shown in pivot's table totals menu when rollup (native) total is disabled because ranking filters are configured for the pivot.

visualizations.totals.dropdown.title.med.comment: Total of type 'Median'. Showed in menu before adding to table.

visualizations.headline.tertiary.title.comment: Means comparison of two values - for example '100 (this week) VERSUS 10 (last week)'.

visualizations.headline.comparison.title.comment: The label of the dropdown option that specifies the arithmetic operation to calculate the change between two values.
The label will be used when the arithmetic operation is `change` and primary value is greater then secondary value.
The label will be used when the arithmetic operation is `change` and primary value is less then secondary value.
The label will be used when the arithmetic operation is `change` and primary value is equals secondary value.
The label of the dropdown option that specifies the arithmetic operation to calculate the the ratio between two values.
The label of the dropdown option that specifies the arithmetic operation to calculate the difference between two values.
The label will be used when the arithmetic operation is `difference` and primary value is greater then secondary value.
The label will be used when the arithmetic operation is `difference` and primary value is less then secondary value.
The label will be used when the arithmetic operation is `difference` and primary value is equals secondary value.

visualizations.headline.pagination.next..comment: Accessibility label for the button that shows the next comparative metric in the headline visualization. Used by screen readers.

visualizations.headline.pagination.previ.comment: Accessibility label for the button that shows the previous comparative metric in the headline visualization. Used by screen readers.

visualizations.headline.pagination.drill.value: Drilling available. Press Enter or Space to continue.
visualizations.headline.pagination.drill.comment: Accessibility hint informing users that they can drill into the visualization by pressing Enter or Space. Used by screen readers.

visualization.numericValues.k.comment: Character 'k' stands for metric prefix kilo (1.000).

visualization.numericValues.m.comment: Character 'M' stands for metric prefix mega (1.000.000).

visualization.numericValues.g.comment: Character 'G' stands for metric prefix giga (1.000.000.000).

visualization.numericValues.t.comment: Character 'T' stands for metric prefix tera (1.000.000.000.000).

visualization.numericValues.p.comment: Character 'P' stands for metric prefix peta (1.000.000.000.000.000).

visualization.numericValues.e.comment: Character 'E' stands for metric prefix exa (1.000.000.000.000.000.000).

visualization.emptyValue.comment: Text displayed when a data field has no value in visualizations. Used to represent null or undefined values.

visualization.waterfall.total.comment: The default name for the waterfall total column

visualization.cluster.comment: The default title for the cluster group

visualization.ErrorMessageGeneric|insigh.value: Sorry, we can't display this visualization
visualization.ErrorMessageGeneric|insigh.comment: Generic error message shown when a visualization cannot be displayed due to an unspecified technical issue.

visualization.ErrorMessageGeneric|report.value: Sorry, we can't display this report
visualization.ErrorMessageGeneric|report.comment: Error message shown when a report cannot be displayed due to an unspecified technical issue. This is the report-specific version of the generic visualization error message.

visualization.ErrorDescriptionGeneric.comment: Follow-up instruction text shown below error messages, advising the user to contact an administrator for help.

visualization.ErrorMessageDataTooLarge.value: Too many data points to display
visualization.ErrorMessageDataTooLarge.comment: Error message shown when visualization cannot be rendered because the dataset is too large for the visualization engine to process.

visualization.ErrorDescriptionDataTooLar.comment: Suggestion shown below the 'Too many data points' error message, advising users to reduce the dataset size by applying filters.

visualization.ErrorMessageNoData.comment: Error message shown when the visualization has no data to display, typically because filters exclude all data or the dataset is empty.

visualization.ErrorDescriptionNoData.value: No data for your filter selection.
visualization.ErrorDescriptionNoData.comment: Explanation shown below the 'No data' error message, indicating that the current filter selection results in no data to display.

visualization.ErrorMessageKpi.comment: Generic error indicator text shown in KPI (Key Performance Indicator) visualizations when they cannot be displayed properly.

visualization.ErrorMessageUnauthorized.comment: Error message shown when the user does not have permission to view the requested visualization or data.

visualization.ErrorDescriptionUnauthoriz.value: Sorry you don't have access to this visualization. Login or ask your administrator to grant you permissions.
visualization.ErrorDescriptionUnauthoriz.comment: Explanation shown when the user lacks permissions to view a visualization, providing instructions for resolution.

visualization.ErrorDescriptionUnauthoriz.value: Sorry you don't have access to this report. Login or ask your administrator to grant you permissions.
visualization.ErrorDescriptionUnauthoriz.comment: Explanation shown when the user lacks permissions to view a report, providing instructions for resolution. This is the report-specific version of the unauthorized access message.

visualization.ErrorMessageNotFound|insig.value: Sorry, we can't find this visualization
visualization.ErrorMessageNotFound|insig.comment: Error message shown when the requested visualization cannot be found, typically because it has been deleted or the URL is incorrect.

visualization.ErrorMessageNotFound|repor.value: Sorry, we can't find this report
visualization.ErrorMessageNotFound|repor.comment: Error message shown when the requested report cannot be found, typically because it has been deleted or the URL is incorrect. This is the report-specific version of the not found message.

visualization.ErrorDescriptionNotFound|i.value: The visualization with this URL does not exist.
visualization.ErrorDescriptionNotFound|i.comment: Explanation shown when a visualization cannot be found, indicating that no visualization exists with the requested identifier.

visualization.ErrorDescriptionNotFound|r.value: The report with this URL does not exist.
visualization.ErrorDescriptionNotFound|r.comment: Explanation shown when a report cannot be found, indicating that no report exists with the requested identifier. This is the report-specific version of the not found description.

visualization.ErrorDescriptionMissingMap.value: The Geochart configuration requires a valid API access token.
visualization.ErrorDescriptionMissingMap.comment: Error message shown when trying to display a geographic visualization without having a valid Mapbox API token configured.

visualization.tooltip.resetZoom.comment: Button tooltip for resetting the zoom level to default in visualizations that support zooming, like charts and maps.

visualization.tooltip.interaction.comment: Informational tooltip that appears over charts, informing users they can click to drill down for more detailed data.

visualization.tooltip.generic.interactio.comment: Informational tooltip that appears over interactive visualization elements, indicating users can click for drilling or filtering actions.

gs.filterLabel.all.comment: Filter option label indicating that all available items or values are selected in a filter control.

gs.filterLabel.none.comment: Filter option label indicating that no items or values are selected in a filter control.

gs.filter.loading.comment: Loading indicator text shown when filter values are being loaded from the server. The ellipsis (…) indicates an in-progress operation.

gs.filter.error.comment: Error message displayed when a filter component fails to load its values from the server.

gs.filter.error.tooltip.comment: Tooltip shown when hovering over a filter that encountered an error when trying to load its values.

gs.list.clear.comment: Button label for clearing all selections in a list or filter component, returning it to empty state.

gs.list.cancel.comment: Button label for canceling the current operation in list or filter components and returning to the previous state.

gs.list.apply.comment: Button label for applying selected filters or options in list or filter components.

gs.list.only.comment: Label used in filter expressions to indicate exclusive selection, e.g., 'Only Product A'.

gs.list.selectAll.comment: Button or option label that allows users to select all available items in a list or filter component.

gs.list.limitExceeded.value: Sorry, you have exceeded the limit ({limit}).
gs.list.limitExceeded.comment: Error message shown when a user exceeds the maximum allowed number of selections in a list component. The {limit} placeholder will be replaced with the actual limit number.

gs.list.limitReached.value: You have reached the limit of {limit} selected values.
gs.list.limitReached.comment: Informational message shown when a user reaches the maximum allowed number of selections in a list component. The {limit} placeholder will be replaced with the actual limit number.

gs.list.cannotSelectMoreValues.value: You cannot select more than {limit} values.
gs.list.cannotSelectMoreValues.comment: Error message shown when a user attempts to select more items than allowed in a list component. The {limit} placeholder will be replaced with the maximum allowed number of selections.

gs.list.noItemsFound.comment: Message displayed when a search or filter operation in a list component returns no results.

gs.list.noResultsMatch.comment: Message displayed when a search query in a list or filter component doesn't match any available items.

gs.list.error.comment: Error message shown when the application fails to load values for a filter from the server.

gs.header.upsellButtonText.comment: Button text for upgrading to a higher tier or paid version of the product from a free or lower tier.

gs.header.invite.comment: Button label for inviting other users to join the workspace or collaborate on dashboards.

gs.header.countdown.numberOfDaysLeft.comment: Text showing the number of days remaining in a trial or subscription period. The {number} placeholder will be replaced with the actual count of days.

gs.header.countdown.numberOfMonthsLeft.comment: Countdown message showing the number of months remaining in a trial or subscription period. The {number} placeholder will be replaced with the actual count of months.

gs.header.countdown.oneMonthLeft.comment: Countdown message indicating that one month remains in the current trial or subscription period.

gs.header.countdown.lastDay.comment: Message shown on the final day of a trial or subscription period, indicating it's the last day of access.

measure.title.suffix.same_period_year_ag.comment: Suffix added to a measure title to indicate it shows data from the same period in the previous year (SP = Same Period). Used in time-based comparisons.

measure.title.suffix.previous_period.comment: Suffix added to a measure title to indicate it shows data from the previous time period. The specific time period (day, week, month, etc.) is determined by the current context.

visualizations.measure.arithmetic.sum.ti.comment: Title of an arithmetic measure of type Sum.

visualizations.measure.arithmetic.differ.comment: Title of an arithmetic measure of type Difference.

visualizations.measure.arithmetic.multip.comment: Title of an arithmetic measure of type Product.

visualizations.measure.arithmetic.ratio..comment: Title of an arithmetic measure of type Ratio.

visualizations.measure.arithmetic.change.comment: Title of an arithmetic measure of type Change.

visualizations.legend.text.top.comment: Legend position option to place the legend above the chart or visualization.

visualizations.legend.text.bottom.comment: Legend position option to place the legend below the chart or visualization.

visualizations.legend.text.left.comment: Legend position option to place the legend to the left of the chart or visualization.

visualizations.legend.text.right.comment: Legend position option to place the legend to the right of the chart or visualization.

visualizations.legend.text.colon.comment: A colon character stands right after legend. eg: 'Left:'

visualizations.legend.text.column.comment: Label for the column chart series type in visualization legends, used to identify data series represented by vertical bars in charts.

visualizations.legend.text.line.comment: Label for the line chart series type in visualization legends, used to identify data series represented by lines in charts.

visualizations.legend.text.area.comment: Label for the area chart series type in visualization legends, used to identify data series represented by areas in charts.

visualizations.legend.text.combo.comment: Combination of chart type & y-axis position. eg: 'Legend settings: Column (Left)' where 'Column' is '{0}' and '(Left)' is '({1})'. You can switch order of placeholders '{0}' and '({1})' for right-to-left languages if makes more sense.

visualizations.pagination.previous.comment: Button label to navigate to the previous page in a paginated view. Shown when there are more items available before the current page.

visualizations.pagination.next.comment: Button label to navigate to the next page in a paginated view. Shown when there are more items available after the current page.

visualizations.menu.aggregations.comment: Heading showed above menu listing possible aggregations (totals). Use imperative.

visualizations.menu.aggregations.rows.comment: Heading showed above row attributes of the table you may apply one of aggregation (total) on.

visualizations.menu.aggregations.columns.comment: Heading showed above columns attributes of the table you may apply one of aggregation (total) on.

visualizations.menu.aggregations.all-row.comment: Menu option that adds row aggregation (grand total) to the table. Example: 'Sum of all rows'

visualizations.menu.aggregations.all-col.comment: Menu option that adds column aggregation (grand total) to the table. Example: 'Sum of all columns'

visualizations.menu.aggregations.within-.comment: Menu option that adds row aggregation (sub-total) for specific attribute to the table. Example: 'Sum within Attribute A'.

apply.comment: Button label to confirm and apply changes or selections in a dialog or form.

cancel.comment: Button label to discard changes and close a dialog or form without applying any changes.

close.comment: Button for closing the popup without triggering any action.

save.comment: Label of save button or visual element

loading.comment: Text shown during content loading operations

dateFilterDropdown.title.comment: Title for the date filter dropdown component, allowing users to select a time range for filtering data.

dateFilterDropdown.setDefault.comment: Message with non-breaking space for proper formatting. The {nbsp} represents a non-breaking space character.

dateFilterDropdown.configuration.comment: Configuration button label in date filter dropdown

dateFilterDropdown.label.comment: Label for the date filter dropdown component, allowing users to select a time range for filtering data.

dateFilterDropdown.relativeForm.label.comment: Label for the granularity selection in the date filter dropdown component, allowing users to select a time range for filtering data.

filters.thisMinute.title.comment: Filter option to select the current minute in time-based filtering controls.

filters.lastMinute.title.comment: Filter option to select the previous minute in time-based filtering controls.

filters.nextMinute.title.comment: Filter option to select the upcoming minute in time-based filtering controls.

filters.thisHour.title.comment: Filter option to select the current hour in time-based filtering controls.

filters.lastHour.title.comment: Filter option to select the previous hour in time-based filtering controls.

filters.nextHour.title.comment: Filter option to select the upcoming hour in time-based filtering controls.

filters.thisDay.title.comment: Filter option for the current day

filters.lastDay.title.comment: Filter option for the previous day

filters.nextDay.title.comment: Filter option for the next day

filters.thisWeek.title.comment: Filter option for the current week

filters.lastWeek.title.comment: Filter option for the previous week

filters.nextWeek.title.comment: Filter option for the next week

filters.thisMonth.title.comment: Filter option for the current month

filters.lastMonth.title.comment: Filter option for the previous month

filters.nextMonth.title.comment: Filter option for the next month

filters.thisQuarter.title.comment: Filter option for the current quarter

filters.lastQuarter.title.comment: Filter option for the previous quarter

filters.nextQuarter.title.comment: Filter option for the next quarter

filters.thisYear.title.comment: Filter option for the current year

filters.lastYear.title.comment: Filter option for the previous year

filters.nextYear.title.comment: Filter option for the next year

filters.lastNMinutes.comment: Filter option for the last N minutes (singular/plural)

filters.lastNHours.comment: Filter option for the last N hours (singular/plural)

filters.lastNDays.comment: Filter option for the last N days (singular/plural)

filters.lastNWeeks.comment: Filter option for the last N weeks (singular/plural)

filters.lastNMonths.comment: Filter option for the last N months (singular/plural)

filters.lastNQuarters.comment: Filter option for the last N quarters (singular/plural)

filters.lastNYears.comment: Filter option for the last N years (singular/plural)

filters.nextNMinutes.comment: Filter option for the next N minutes (singular/plural)

filters.nextNHours.comment: Filter option for the next N hours (singular/plural)

filters.nextNDays.comment: Filter option for the next N days (singular/plural)

filters.nextNWeeks.comment: Filter option for the next N weeks (singular/plural)

filters.nextNMonths.comment: Filter option for the next N months (singular/plural)

filters.nextNQuarters.comment: Filter option for the next N quarters (singular/plural)

filters.nextNYears.comment: Filter option for the next N years (singular/plural)

filters.interval.minutes.past.value: From {from} to {to} {to, plural, one {minute} other {minutes}} ago
filters.interval.minutes.past.comment: Time interval in past minutes (e.g., 'From 5 to 10 minutes ago')

filters.interval.minutes.past.sameValue.comment: Time interval for a single past minute (e.g., '5 minutes ago')

filters.interval.minutes.future.value: From {from} to {to} {to, plural, one {minute} other {minutes}} ahead
filters.interval.minutes.future.comment: Time interval in future minutes (e.g., 'From 5 to 10 minutes ahead')

filters.interval.minutes.future.sameValu.comment: Time interval for a single future minute (e.g., '5 minutes ahead')

filters.interval.minutes.mixed.value: From {from} {from, plural, one {minute} other {minutes}} ago to {to} {to, plural, one {minute} other {minutes}} ahead
filters.interval.minutes.mixed.comment: Time interval spanning past and future in minutes (e.g., 'From 1 minute ago to 2 minutes ahead')

filters.interval.hours.past.value: From {from} to {to} {to, plural, one {hour} other {hours}} ago
filters.interval.hours.past.comment: Time interval in past hours (e.g., 'From 1 to 3 hours ago')

filters.interval.hours.past.sameValue.comment: Time interval for a single past hour (e.g., '2 hours ago')

filters.interval.hours.future.value: From {from} to {to} {to, plural, one {hour} other {hours}} ahead
filters.interval.hours.future.comment: Time interval in future hours (e.g., 'From 1 to 3 hours ahead')

filters.interval.hours.future.sameValue.comment: Time interval for a single future hour (e.g., '2 hours ahead')

filters.interval.hours.mixed.value: From {from} {from, plural, one {hour} other {hours}} ago to {to} {to, plural, one {hour} other {hours}} ahead
filters.interval.hours.mixed.comment: Time interval spanning past and future in hours (e.g., 'From 1 hour ago to 2 hours ahead')

filters.interval.days.past.value: From {from} to {to} {to, plural, one {day} other {days}} ago
filters.interval.days.past.comment: Time interval in past days (e.g., 'From 1 to 3 days ago')

filters.interval.days.past.sameValue.comment: Time interval for a single past day (e.g., '2 days ago')

filters.interval.days.future.value: From {from} to {to} {to, plural, one {day} other {days}} ahead
filters.interval.days.future.comment: Time interval for future days with a range, showing the number of days ahead (e.g., 'From 2 to 4 days ahead'). The placeholders {from} and {to} represent the start and end days.

filters.interval.days.future.sameValue.comment: Time interval for a single future day (e.g., '2 days ahead'). The placeholder {value} represents the number of days.

filters.interval.days.mixed.value: From {from} {from, plural, one {day} other {days}} ago to {to} {to, plural, one {day} other {days}} ahead
filters.interval.days.mixed.comment: Time interval spanning both past and future days (e.g., 'From 1 day ago to 2 days ahead'). The placeholders {from} and {to} represent the number of days in the past and future respectively.

filters.interval.weeks.past.value: From {from} to {to} {to, plural, one {week} other {weeks}} ago
filters.interval.weeks.past.comment: Time interval for past weeks with a range, showing the number of weeks ago (e.g., 'From 2 to 4 weeks ago'). The placeholders {from} and {to} represent the start and end weeks.

filters.interval.weeks.past.sameValue.comment: Time interval for a single past week (e.g., '2 weeks ago'). The placeholder {value} represents the number of weeks.

filters.interval.weeks.future.value: From {from} to {to} {to, plural, one {week} other {weeks}} ahead
filters.interval.weeks.future.comment: Time interval for future weeks with a range, showing the number of weeks ahead (e.g., 'From 2 to 4 weeks ahead'). The placeholders {from} and {to} represent the start and end weeks.

filters.interval.weeks.future.sameValue.comment: Time interval for a single future week (e.g., '2 weeks ahead'). The placeholder {value} represents the number of weeks.

filters.interval.weeks.mixed.value: From {from} {from, plural, one {week} other {weeks}} ago to {to} {to, plural, one {week} other {weeks}} ahead
filters.interval.weeks.mixed.comment: Time interval spanning both past and future weeks (e.g., 'From 1 week ago to 2 weeks ahead'). The placeholders {from} and {to} represent the number of weeks in the past and future respectively.

filters.interval.months.past.value: From {from} to {to} {to, plural, one {month} other {months}} ago
filters.interval.months.past.comment: Time interval for past months with a range, showing the number of months ago (e.g., 'From 2 to 4 months ago'). The placeholders {from} and {to} represent the start and end months.

filters.interval.months.past.sameValue.comment: Time interval for a single past month (e.g., '2 months ago'). The placeholder {value} represents the number of months.

filters.interval.months.future.value: From {from} to {to} {to, plural, one {month} other {months}} ahead
filters.interval.months.future.comment: Time interval for future months with a range, showing the number of months ahead (e.g., 'From 2 to 4 months ahead'). The placeholders {from} and {to} represent the start and end months.

filters.interval.months.future.sameValue.comment: Time interval for a single future month (e.g., '2 months ahead'). The placeholder {value} represents the number of months.

filters.interval.months.mixed.value: From {from} {from, plural, one {month} other {months}} ago to {to} {to, plural, one {month} other {months}} ahead
filters.interval.months.mixed.comment: Time interval spanning both past and future months (e.g., 'From 1 month ago to 2 months ahead'). The placeholders {from} and {to} represent the number of months in the past and future respectively.

filters.interval.quarters.past.value: From {from} to {to} {to, plural, one {quarter} other {quarters}} ago
filters.interval.quarters.past.comment: Time interval for past quarters with a range, showing the number of quarters ago (e.g., 'From Q2 to Q4 last year'). The placeholders {from} and {to} represent the start and end quarters.

filters.interval.quarters.past.sameValue.comment: Time interval for a single past quarter (e.g., '2 quarters ago'). The placeholder {value} represents the number of quarters.

filters.interval.quarters.future.value: From {from} to {to} {to, plural, one {quarter} other {quarters}} ahead
filters.interval.quarters.future.comment: Time interval for future quarters with a range, showing the number of quarters ahead (e.g., 'From Q3 to Q4 next year'). The placeholders {from} and {to} represent the start and end quarters.

filters.interval.quarters.future.sameVal.comment: Time interval for a single future quarter (e.g., '2 quarters ahead'). The placeholder {value} represents the number of quarters.

filters.interval.quarters.mixed.value: From {from} {from, plural, one {quarter} other {quarters}} ago to {to} {to, plural, one {quarter} other {quarters}} ahead
filters.interval.quarters.mixed.comment: Time interval spanning both past and future quarters (e.g., 'From Q1 last year to Q2 next year'). The placeholders {from} and {to} represent the number of quarters in the past and future respectively.

filters.interval.years.past.value: From {from} to {to} {to, plural, one {year} other {years}} ago
filters.interval.years.past.comment: Time interval for past years with a range, showing the number of years ago (e.g., 'From 2 to 4 years ago'). The placeholders {from} and {to} represent the start and end years.

filters.interval.years.past.sameValue.comment: Time interval for a single past year (e.g., '2 years ago'). The placeholder {value} represents the number of years.

filters.interval.years.future.value: From {from} to {to} {to, plural, one {year} other {years}} ahead
filters.interval.years.future.comment: Time interval for future years with a range, showing the number of years ahead (e.g., 'From 2025 to 2027'). The placeholders {from} and {to} represent the start and end years.

filters.interval.years.future.sameValue.comment: Time interval for a single future year (e.g., '2 years ahead'). The placeholder {value} represents the number of years.

filters.interval.years.mixed.value: From {from} {from, plural, one {year} other {years}} ago to {to} {to, plural, one {year} other {years}} ahead
filters.interval.years.mixed.comment: Time interval spanning both past and future years (e.g., 'From 1 year ago to 2 years ahead'). The placeholders {from} and {to} represent the number of years in the past and future respectively.

filters.granularity.minutes.comment: Time granularity option for filtering data at the minute level. Used in time-based filters and selectors.

filters.granularity.hours.comment: Time granularity option for filtering data at the hour level. Used in time-based filters and selectors.

filters.granularity.days.comment: Time granularity option for filtering data at the day level. Used in time-based filters and selectors.

filters.granularity.weeks.comment: Time granularity option for filtering data at the week level. Used in time-based filters and selectors.

filters.granularity.months.comment: Time granularity option for filtering data at the month level. Used in time-based filters and selectors.

filters.granularity.quarters.comment: Time granularity option for filtering data at the quarter level. Used in time-based filters and selectors.

filters.granularity.years.comment: Time granularity option for filtering data at the year level. Used in time-based filters and selectors.

filters.staticPeriod.dateFrom.comment: Displayed as label of input where user enters a date that marks the start of date range.

filters.staticPeriod.timeFrom.comment: Displayed as label of input where user enters a time that marks the start of date range.

filters.staticPeriod.dateTo.comment: Displayed as label of input where user enters a date that marks the end of date range.

filters.staticPeriod.timeTo.comment: Displayed as label of input where user enters a time that marks the end of date range.

filters.staticPeriod.dateFormatHint.comment: Date input field hint. The {format} placeholder shows the expected date format pattern (e.g., 'MM/DD/YYYY').

filters.staticPeriod.timeFormatHint.value: Use time format HH:MM; max value is 23:59.
filters.staticPeriod.timeFormatHint.comment: Displayed as a hint below input in which user enters a time.

filters.date.accessibility.label.from.comment: Accessibility label for the 'from' date input field in date range selectors. Used by screen readers to identify the start date selection.

filters.date.accessibility.label.to.comment: Accessibility label for the 'to' date input field in date range selectors. Used by screen readers to identify the end date selection.

filters.time.accessibility.label.from.comment: Accessibility label for the 'from' time input field in time range selectors. Used by screen readers to identify the start time selection.

filters.time.accessibility.label.to.comment: Accessibility label for the 'to' time input field in time range selectors. Used by screen readers to identify the end time selection.

filters.relative.placeholder.comment: Placeholder text shown in relative date filter inputs, indicating users can either type a value or select from a list of options.

filters.relative.from.label.comment: Label for the starting point of a relative time period in date range selectors. Indicates where the time period begins.

filters.relative.from.invalid.value.value: Error: Invalid period start — enter a valid period or select it from the list.
filters.relative.from.invalid.value.comment: Error message shown when an invalid value is entered for the start of a relative time period. Guides users to enter a valid value or select from available options.

filters.relative.from.empty.value.value: Error: Period start is empty — enter a valid period or select it from the list.
filters.relative.from.empty.value.comment: Error message shown when the start period field is left empty in a relative date filter. Guides users to provide a valid value or select from available options.

filters.relative.to.label.comment: Label for the ending point of a relative time period in date range selectors. Indicates where the time period concludes.

filters.relative.to.invalid.value.value: Error: Invalid period end — enter a valid period or select it from the list.
filters.relative.to.invalid.value.comment: Error message shown when an invalid value is entered for the end of a relative time period. Helps users correct their input with valid values.

filters.relative.to.empty.value.value: Error: Period end is empty — enter a valid period or select it from the list.
filters.relative.to.empty.value.comment: Error message shown when the end period field is left empty in a relative date filter. Prompts users to provide a valid value or select from available options.

filters.floatingRange.comment: Label for the relative period filter option, allowing users to select time periods relative to the current date (e.g., 'Last 7 days').

filters.floatingRange.tooltip.value: The date range is relative to today and adjusts in time.
filters.floatingRange.tooltip.comment: Tooltip explaining that the relative period filter will automatically update based on the current date, ensuring the time window remains consistent (e.g., 'Last 30 days' will always show the most recent 30 days).

filters.floatingRange.noMatch.comment: Message displayed when a search or filter operation in the relative period selector doesn't return any matching results.

filters.floatingRange.tooBig.comment: Error message shown when a user enters a value exceeding the maximum allowed limit in a relative period filter. Example: 'Maximum value: 100'.

filters.floatingRange.option.minute.offs.value: {n, plural, one {last minute} other {# minutes ago}}
filters.floatingRange.option.minute.offs.comment: Relative time expression using plural forms. Keep the {n, plural, ...} format and the # placeholder for numbers. Examples: 'last minute', '5 minutes ago', 'next hour', '3 days ahead'.
Option in the relative time selector referring to the current minute. Used when filtering data to include only the current minute's data.

filters.floatingRange.option.minute.offs.value: {n, plural, one {next minute} other {# minutes ahead}}
filters.floatingRange.option.minute.offs.comment: Relative time expression using plural forms. Keep the {n, plural, ...} format and the # placeholder for numbers. Examples: 'last minute', '5 minutes ago', 'next hour', '3 days ahead'.

filters.floatingRange.option.hour.offset.value: {n, plural, one {last hour} other {# hours ago}}
filters.floatingRange.option.hour.offset.comment: Relative time expression using plural forms. Keep the {n, plural, ...} format and the # placeholder for numbers. Examples: 'last minute', '5 minutes ago', 'next hour', '3 days ahead'.
Relative time filter option referring to the current hour. Used to filter data for the current 60-minute period.

filters.floatingRange.option.hour.offset.value: {n, plural, one {next hour} other {# hours ahead}}
filters.floatingRange.option.hour.offset.comment: Relative time expression using plural forms. Keep the {n, plural, ...} format and the # placeholder for numbers. Examples: 'last minute', '5 minutes ago', 'next hour', '3 days ahead'.

filters.floatingRange.option.day.offset..comment: Relative time expression using plural forms. Keep the {n, plural, ...} format and the # placeholder for numbers. Examples: 'last minute', '5 minutes ago', 'next hour', '3 days ahead'.
Relative time filter option for the current calendar day. Used to filter data for the current 24-hour period from midnight to midnight.
Relative time expression using plural forms. Keep the {n, plural, ...} format and the # placeholder for numbers. Examples: 'last minute', '5 minutes ago', 'next hour', '3 days ahead'.

filters.floatingRange.option.week.offset.value: {n, plural, one {last week} other {# weeks ago}}
filters.floatingRange.option.week.offset.comment: Relative time filter option for past weeks. The placeholder {n} represents the number of weeks ago. Used in time-based filtering to reference previous weeks.
Relative time filter option for the current calendar week (typically Sunday to Saturday or Monday to Sunday, depending on locale). Used to filter data for the current 7-day period.

filters.floatingRange.option.week.offset.value: {n, plural, one {next week} other {# weeks ahead}}
filters.floatingRange.option.week.offset.comment: Relative time expression using plural forms. Keep the {n, plural, ...} format and the # placeholder for numbers. Examples: 'last minute', '5 minutes ago', 'next hour', '3 days ahead'.

filters.floatingRange.option.month.offse.value: {n, plural, one {last month} other {# months ago}}
filters.floatingRange.option.month.offse.comment: Relative time expression using plural forms. Keep the {n, plural, ...} format and the # placeholder for numbers. Examples: 'last minute', '5 minutes ago', 'next hour', '3 days ahead'.
Relative time filter option for the current calendar month. Used to filter data for the current month from first to last day.

filters.floatingRange.option.month.offse.value: {n, plural, one {next month} other {# months ahead}}
filters.floatingRange.option.month.offse.comment: Relative time expression using plural forms. Keep the {n, plural, ...} format and the # placeholder for numbers. Examples: 'last minute', '5 minutes ago', 'next hour', '3 days ahead'.

filters.floatingRange.option.quarter.off.value: {n, plural, one {last quarter} other {# quarters ago}}
filters.floatingRange.option.quarter.off.comment: Relative time expression using plural forms. Keep the {n, plural, ...} format and the # placeholder for numbers. Examples: 'last minute', '5 minutes ago', 'next hour', '3 days ahead'.
Relative time filter option for the current calendar quarter (Q1: Jan-Mar, Q2: Apr-Jun, etc.). Used to filter data for the current 3-month period.

filters.floatingRange.option.quarter.off.value: {n, plural, one {next quarter} other {# quarters ahead}}
filters.floatingRange.option.quarter.off.comment: Relative time expression using plural forms. Keep the {n, plural, ...} format and the # placeholder for numbers. Examples: 'last minute', '5 minutes ago', 'next hour', '3 days ahead'.

filters.floatingRange.option.year.offset.value: {n, plural, one {last year} other {# years ago}}
filters.floatingRange.option.year.offset.comment: Relative time expression using plural forms. Keep the {n, plural, ...} format and the # placeholder for numbers. Examples: 'last minute', '5 minutes ago', 'next hour', '3 days ahead'.
Relative time filter option for the current calendar year. Used to filter data for the current 12-month period from January to December.

filters.floatingRange.option.year.offset.value: {n, plural, one {next year} other {# years ahead}}
filters.floatingRange.option.year.offset.comment: Relative time expression using plural forms. Keep the {n, plural, ...} format and the # placeholder for numbers. Examples: 'last minute', '5 minutes ago', 'next hour', '3 days ahead'.

filters.allTime.title.comment: Filter option indicating no time-based filtering should be applied, including all available historical data in the results.

filters.allTime.excludeCurrentPeriod.comment: Option to exclude incomplete or in-progress time periods from the 'All time' filter, such as the current day, week, or month that hasn't fully elapsed.

filters.minute.title.comment: Header label for minute-level time filter options. Used in filter configuration interfaces to group minute-related filtering controls.

filters.minute.excludeCurrentPeriod.comment: Option to exclude the current minute from the filtered results. Useful when the current minute might contain incomplete or in-progress data.

filters.hour.title.comment: Header label for hour-level time filter options. Used in filter configuration interfaces to group hour-related filtering controls.

filters.hour.excludeCurrentPeriod.comment: Option to exclude the current hour from the filtered results. Useful when the current hour might contain incomplete or in-progress data.

filters.day.title.comment: Header label for day-level time filter options. Used in filter configuration interfaces to group day-related filtering controls.

filters.day.excludeCurrentPeriod.comment: Option to exclude the current day from the filtered results. Useful when today's data might be incomplete or still being collected.

filters.week.title.comment: Header label for week-level time filter options. Used in filter configuration interfaces to group week-related filtering controls.

filters.week.excludeCurrentPeriod.comment: Option to exclude the current week from the filtered results. Useful when the current week's data might be incomplete or still being collected.

filters.month.title.comment: Header label for month-level time filter options. Used in filter configuration interfaces to group month-related filtering controls.

filters.month.excludeCurrentPeriod.comment: Option to exclude the current month from the filtered results. Useful when the current month's data might be incomplete or still being collected.

filters.quarter.title.comment: Header label for quarter-level time filter options. Used in filter configuration interfaces to group quarter-related filtering controls.

filters.quarter.excludeCurrentPeriod.comment: Option to exclude the current quarter from the filtered results. Useful when the current quarter's data might be incomplete or still being collected.

filters.year.title.comment: Header label for year-level time filter options. Used in filter configuration interfaces to group year-related filtering controls.

filters.year.excludeCurrentPeriod.comment: Option to exclude the current year from the filtered results. Useful when the current year's data might be incomplete or still being collected.

filters.excludeCurrentPeriod.unavailable.value: Not available for the selected date range
filters.excludeCurrentPeriod.unavailable.comment: Message displayed when the 'exclude current period' option is not applicable to the currently selected date range filter settings.

filters.staticPeriod.comment: Label for the static period filter option, allowing users to select fixed date ranges that don't change over time (as opposed to relative periods).

filters.staticPeriod.errors.emptyStartDa.value: Error: Start date is empty — enter a valid date to continue.
filters.staticPeriod.errors.emptyStartDa.comment: The error is displayed when user did not entered value that specifies start of the daterange.

filters.staticPeriod.errors.invalidStart.value: Error: Invalid start date — use {format} format.
filters.staticPeriod.errors.invalidStart.comment: Placeholder '{format}' is used for showing date format. Example 'Error: Start date is not in MM/dd/yyyy format'.

filters.staticPeriod.errors.startDateAft.value: Error: Invalid start date — set a date before the end date.
filters.staticPeriod.errors.startDateAft.comment: This error is displayed once there is a datetime range and Start date is after End date.

filters.staticPeriod.errors.startTimeAft.value: Error: Invalid start time — set a time before the end time.
filters.staticPeriod.errors.startTimeAft.comment: This error is displayed once there is a datetime range and Start time is after End time.

filters.staticPeriod.errors.emptyEndDate.value: Error: End date is empty — enter a valid date to continue.
filters.staticPeriod.errors.emptyEndDate.comment: The error is displayed when user did not entered value that specifies end of the daterange.

filters.staticPeriod.errors.invalidEndDa.value: Error: Invalid end date — use {format} format.
filters.staticPeriod.errors.invalidEndDa.comment: Placeholder '{format}' is used for showing date format. Example 'Error: End date is not in MM/dd/yyyy format'.

filters.staticPeriod.errors.endDateBefor.value: Error: Invalid end date — set a date after the start date.
filters.staticPeriod.errors.endDateBefor.comment: This error is displayed once there is a datetime range and End date is before Start date.

filters.staticPeriod.errors.endTimeBefor.value: Error: Invalid end time — set a time after the start time.
filters.staticPeriod.errors.endTimeBefor.comment: This error is displayed once there is a datetime range and End time is before Start time.

mvf.operator.all.comment: Covers all the operators like 'Greater than', 'Less than', etc.

mvf.operator.greaterThan.comment: Filter operator that matches values greater than the specified value. Used in measure value filters to filter data points above a certain threshold.

mvf.operator.greaterThanOrEqualTo.comment: Filter operator that matches values greater than or equal to the specified value. Used in measure value filters to include the threshold value in the results.

mvf.operator.lessThan.comment: Filter operator that matches values less than the specified value. Used in measure value filters to filter data points below a certain threshold.

mvf.operator.lessThanOrEqualTo.comment: Filter operator that matches values less than or equal to the specified value. Used in measure value filters to include the threshold value in the results.

mvf.operator.equalTo.comment: Filter operator that matches values exactly equal to the specified value. Used in measure value filters to find specific data points.

mvf.operator.notEqualTo.comment: Filter operator that matches all values except the specified value. Used in measure value filters to exclude specific data points.

mvf.operator.between.comment: Filter operator that matches values within a specified range (inclusive of boundaries). Used in measure value filters to find data points within a specific range.

mvf.operator.notBetween.comment: Filter operator that matches values outside a specified range (exclusive of boundaries). Used in measure value filters to exclude data points within a specific range.

mvf.operator.between.tooltip.bubble.value: Start and end values are included.
mvf.operator.between.tooltip.bubble.comment: Tooltip explaining that when using the 'between' operator, the range is inclusive of both the start and end values in the filter criteria.

mvf.operator.notBetween.tooltip.bubble.value: Start and end values are not included.
mvf.operator.notBetween.tooltip.bubble.comment: Tooltip explaining that when using the 'not between' operator, the range is exclusive of both the start and end values in the filter criteria.

mvf.treatNullValuesAsZeroLabel.comment: Checkbox label. 'blank values' are data rows without any value (empty), which can be considered to be 0 in calculations.

mvf.treatNullValuesAsZeroTooltip.value: If the filter condition includes 0, blank values will be treated as 0 and included in calculations.
mvf.treatNullValuesAsZeroTooltip.comment: Checkbox label tooltip. 'blank values' are data rows without any value (empty), which can be considered to be 0 during calculations. If the filter is set to '< 1' for example, it includes values of 0 (less than one) and therefore all the blank (empty) values are going to be considered to be 0 in calculations.

measureNumberFormat.custom.optionLabel.comment: An item in list of presets. Denotes a custom preset

measureNumberFormat.buttonLabel.comment: A label informing the user about the currently selected format. The values of selectedFormatPresetName can be for instance 'Whole number', 'Decimal number', or 'Custom'

measureNumberCustomFormatDialog.title.comment: Title of the dialog for setting a custom measure format.

measureNumberCustomFormatDialog.template.comment: The title of the help bubble for custom measure format template
Title of the list of templates

measureNumberCustomFormatDialog.extended.comment: The title of button which will display more examples

properties.legend.title.comment: Title for the legend section in visualization properties. The legend provides a key to the colors and patterns used in the chart.

properties.legend.series.item.descriptio.value: Press Space or Enter to toggle visibility
properties.legend.series.item.descriptio.comment: Tooltip for legend items. Space and Enter stands for keyboard keys.

properties.legend.more.button.value: Show all legend items in a dialog
properties.legend.more.button.comment: Button text for opening a dialog to show all legend items

properties.legend.series.named.comment: Title for a named legend item in visualization properties. {name} is a placeholder for the legend name.

properties.legend.series.unnamed.comment: Title for the legend section in visualization properties. The legend provides a key to the colors and patterns used in the chart.

attrf.all.comment: Option to select all items in an attribute filter. When selected, the filter will include all possible values of the attribute.

attrf.all_except.comment: Option to exclude specific items from an attribute filter. When selected, all values except the specified ones will be included in the filter.

rankingFilter.allRecords.tooltip|insight.value: Apply the filter to all attributes in the visualization.

rankingFilter.allRecords.tooltip|report.value: Apply the filter to all attributes in the report.

rankingFilter.attributeDropdown.oneAttri.value: The visualization is sliced only by one attribute. The filter will apply to all its values.
rankingFilter.attributeDropdown.oneAttri.comment: Tooltip when no options are available for attribute dropdown.

rankingFilter.attributeDropdown.oneAttri.value: The report is sliced only by one attribute. The filter will apply to all its values.
rankingFilter.attributeDropdown.oneAttri.comment: Tooltip when no options are available for attribute dropdown.

rankingFilter.outOf.comment: Section title to specify ranking attribute.

rankingFilter.basedOn.comment: Section title to specify ranking by measure.

rankingFilter.valueTooSmall.value: Input value should be a positive number.
rankingFilter.valueTooSmall.comment: Warning message when value is lower than 1.

rankingFilter.valueTooLarge.comment: Warning message when value is too large.

rankingFilter.preview.comment: Section title that shows ranking filter preview.

rankingFilter.preview.top_without_attrib.comment: Preview text showing the top N values based on a measure, where {value} is the number of items and {measure} is the measure name. Used when no attribute is specified for ranking.

rankingFilter.preview.bottom_without_att.comment: Preview text showing the bottom N values based on a measure, where {value} is the number of items and {measure} is the measure name. Used when no attribute is specified for ranking.

rankingFilter.preview.top_with_attribute.comment: Preview text showing the top N values of a specific attribute based on a measure, where {value} is the number of items, {attribute} is the attribute name, and {measure} is the measure name.

rankingFilter.preview.bottom_with_attrib.comment: Preview text showing the bottom N values of a specific attribute based on a measure, where {value} is the number of items, {attribute} is the attribute name, and {measure} is the measure name.

rankingFilter.valueTooltip|insight.value: If multiple items have the same value, the filter shows all items with this value. The visualization may then display more items than the number set.
rankingFilter.valueTooltip|insight.comment: Tooltip with explanation of why ranking filter can return more rows than the number user entered in the filter.

rankingFilter.valueTooltip|report.value: If multiple items have the same value, the filter shows all items with this value. The report may then display more items than the number set.
rankingFilter.valueTooltip|report.comment: Tooltip with explanation of why ranking filter can return more rows than the number user entered in the filter.

attributesDropdown.itemsFiltered.tooltip.comment: Tooltip explaining which filters are currently applied to the attribute dropdown items. The {filters} placeholder will be replaced with the names of active filters.

attributesDropdown.itemsFiltered.comment: This message is displayed when attribute elements are being filtered out by parent filters

attributeFilterDropdown.emptyValue.comment: Display text for empty or null values in the attribute filter dropdown. Used when an attribute has no value assigned.

attributesDropdown.noData.comment: This message is displayed when when there are no items available because the attribute has no elements.

attributesDropdown.noResultsMatch.comment: This message is displayed when when there are no items available because they were filtered out by search.

attributesDropdown.allItemsFiltered.comment: This message is displayed when there are no items available because they were filtered out by parent filters.

attributesDropdown.configuration.comment: Configuration button label in attribute filter dropdown

attributesDropdown.removeTooltip.comment: Tooltip text of button for deleting filter

attributesDropdown.display_as.comment: Label shown on dropdown button that changes form of the attribute used in visualization. For example 'Display as: Shortened name'

attributesDropdown.empty.item.tooltip.comment: Tooltip text of how selecting an (empty value) item affects the values shown.

attributesDropdown.filterConfiguredMessa.value: {parentTitle} is already filtered by {childTitle} filter directly or through other filters.
attributesDropdown.filterConfiguredMessa.comment: Message explaining filter configuration status. The <strong> tags emphasize attribute names, and {parentTitle}/{childTitle} show the specific filter names.

attributesDropdown.attributeNameWithData.comment: Will be used in sentence between two nouns. For instance 'Filter by AttributeX with data of MetricY'

attributesDropdown.noConnectionMessage.value: {childTitle} cannot be filtered by {parentTitle}. There is no connection between the filter attributes in the data model.
attributesDropdown.noConnectionMessage.comment: Message explaining that a filter cannot be applied because there is no connection between the filter attributes in the data model.

attributesDropdown.details.type.comment: Label indicating the type of metadata being displayed, in this case an 'Attribute' type field in the attribute dropdown details.

attributesDropdown.details.dataset.comment: Label for the dataset field in the attribute dropdown details, showing which dataset the attribute belongs to.

attributesDropdown.relevantValues.comment: Message explaining that only relevant values are displayed in the dropdown.

attributesDropdown.relevantValues.toolti.value: Available values for {child} are filtered by selected {parents}.
attributesDropdown.relevantValues.toolti.comment: Message about filter dependencies. The <strong> tags emphasize filter names, and {child}/{parents} placeholders show the specific filter relationships.

attributesDropdown.relevantValues.toolti.value: Values for {child} are filtered by an additional filter setting.
attributesDropdown.relevantValues.toolti.comment: Message about filter dependencies. The <strong> tags emphasize filter names, and {child}/{parents} placeholders show the specific filter relationships.

attributesDropdown.relevantValues.toolti.value: Values for {child} are filtered by the selected {parents} and an additional filter setting.
attributesDropdown.relevantValues.toolti.comment: Message about filter dependencies. The <strong> tags emphasize filter names, and {child}/{parents} placeholders show the specific filter relationships.

attributesDropdown.noRelevantValues.comment: Message displayed when there are no matching values available in the dropdown based on the current filter criteria.

attributesDropdown.noRelevantValues.tool.value: Your selection in the dependent filter has resulted in no matching values for this filter.{break}Click 'Show all' to see all available options.
attributesDropdown.noRelevantValues.tool.comment: Tooltip explaining that the current filter combination yields no results and suggests viewing all available options by clicking the 'Show all' button.

attributesDropdown.irrelevantValues.comment: Message with non-breaking space for proper formatting. The {nbsp} represents a non-breaking space character.

attributesDropdown.irrelevantValues.tool.value: Selected value is no longer relevant due to changes in {parents}.
attributesDropdown.irrelevantValues.tool.comment: Message about parent filter restrictions. The <strong> tags emphasize filter names, and {parents} shows the list of conflicting filters.

attributesDropdown.irrelevantValues.clea.comment: Button label for clearing the current selection of irrelevant values in the attribute filter dropdown.

attributesDropdown.showAll.comment: Button label that reveals all available options in the dropdown, regardless of current filter settings.

shareDialog.share.grantee.title.comment: Title of dialog used for sharing of private dashboard with other users or user groups.

shareDialog.share.dashboard.title.comment: Title of dialog used for sharing dashboard.

shareDialog.share.dashboard.list.title.comment: Title shown above list of grantees in share dialog.

shareDialog.share.link.helperText.value: Link reflects current filters. Only accessible to users with dashboard access.
shareDialog.share.link.helperText.comment: Helper text shown below the share link input in the share dialog.

shareDialog.share.link.title.comment: Title shown above the share link input in the share dialog.

shareDialog.share.link.buttonText.comment: Label of button that copies the share link to the clipboard.

shareDialog.share.grantee.share.comment: Title of confirm button of share dialog

shareDialog.share.grantee.list.title.comment: Title shown above list of grantees in share dialog.

shareDialog.share.grantee.add.comment: Label of button than adds a new grantee in share dialog.

shareDialog.share.grantee.addLabel.comment: Label of button than adds a new grantee in share dialog.

shareDialog.share.grantee.add.empty.sele.comment: Information message shown when there is no user or group in grantees list in share dialog.

shareDialog.share.grantee.add.info.comment: Title of dialog used for sharing of private dashboard with other users or user groups.

shareDialog.share.grantee.add.search.pla.comment: Placeholder of empty share dialog search input.

shareDialog.share.grantee.add.search.err.value: Failed to load users and groups. Try again later.
shareDialog.share.grantee.add.search.err.comment: Error message shown to the user when query in search input failed

shareDialog.share.grantee.add.label.user.comment: Label shown to the user when query in search input matches an user

shareDialog.share.grantee.add.label.grou.comment: Label shown to the user when query in search input matches a group of users

shareDialog.share.grantee.add.search.no..comment: Information shown to the user when query in search input does no match any user or group.

shareDialog.share.grantee.item.you.comment: Text used for currently logged user in the list of grantees in share dialog. '{userName}' placeholder is replaced with logged user name, for example, 'John Doe (You)'. Keep {userName} placeholder unchanged.

shareDialog.share.grantee.item.users.cou.comment: Description of grantee user group in share dialog that informs about how many users are in the group. {granteeCount} placeholder will be replaced with a number, for example '110 users'

shareDialog.share.grantee.item.creator.comment: Tag rendered next to the name of a user in grantees list in share dialog that marks user as creator of the shared dashboard. The text is rendered in a 'pill' component.

shareDialog.share.grantee.item.user.all.comment: Title of user group that contains all the users in the system.

shareDialog.share.grantee.item.user.inac.comment: Title of user that is inactive or deleted in workspace

shareDialog.share.grantee.item.user.inac.value: User was deleted from this workspace

shareDialog.share.grantee.item.remove.se.comment: Text of the tooltip shown above button that removes user or group from unsaved selection of newly added grantees that will gain access right to the dashboard after changes in share dialog are saved.

shareDialog.share.granular.grantee.permi.comment: Permission level that grants the user full edit and share capabilities for the dashboard, including modifying content and managing access for others.
Permission level that allows users to view the dashboard and share it with others, but not modify the dashboard content.
Basic read-only permission level that allows users to view the dashboard content but not make any changes or share it with others.
Button label for removing a user's or group's permissions entirely from the dashboard.

shareDialog.share.granular.granularUser..value: You cannot remove or change permissions for users with higher permissions than you have.

recurrence.types.weekly.comment: Example: 'Weekly on Friday'. Placeholder '{day}' refers to a day of a week.

recurrence.types.monthly.last.comment: Example: 'Monthly on the last Friday'. The placeholder {day} will be replaced with a day of the week name like 'Friday', 'Monday', etc.

recurrence.types.monthly.comment: Recurrence pattern description. The placeholder {week} will be replaced with a number (1-4) to select the appropriate week ordinal, and {day} will be replaced with a day name. Examples: 'Monthly on the first Friday', 'Monthly on the second Monday', 'Monthly on the last Sunday'.

recurrence.types.cron.comment: Repeats the schedule email using custom cron expression defined by the user. Do not translate word 'Cron' as it is a name of technical specification.

recurrence.types.inherit.comment: Repeats the schedule email using the same recurrence as the setup in parent.

recurrence.types.inherit.info.value: Use the default evaluation frequency set by your organization.

recurrence.description.hourly.comment: Description of hourly recurrence pattern, indicating execution at the beginning of each hour.

recurrence.description.daily.comment: The placeholder {hour} will be replaced with a time value like '9:00 AM', '14:30', etc.

recurrence.description.weekly_first.comment: The placeholder {hour} will be replaced with a time value like '9:00 AM', '14:30', etc.

recurrence.description.weekly.comment: The placeholder {hour} will be replaced with a time value like '9:00 AM', '14:30', etc. The placeholder {dayOfWeekName} will be replaced with a day name like 'Monday', 'Tuesday', etc.

recurrence.description.monthly_first.comment: The placeholder {hour} will be replaced with a time value like '9:00 AM', '14:30', etc.

recurrence.description.monthly.value: At {hour} on {dayOfWeekName} every {weekNumber}. week in month
recurrence.description.monthly.comment: The placeholder {hour} will be replaced with a time value like '9:00 AM', '14:30', etc. The placeholder {dayOfWeekName} will be replaced with a day name like 'Monday', 'Tuesday', etc. The placeholder {weekNumber} will be replaced with a number like '1', '2', '3', etc.

recurrence.error.too_often.value: Error: Frequency too high — reduce to max 1 per hour

recurrence.error.wrongFormat.value: Error: Invalid format — use Spring cron format with six fields: seconds, minutes, hours, day of month, month, and day of week. Learn more
recurrence.error.wrongFormat.comment: Input field has wrong format. The <a> tags create clickable help links for assistance.
